intro: Garapatica, commonly known as the silverleaf nightshade, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes other well-known plants like tomatoes and potatoes. The plant is characterized by its hairy, silver-gray leaves and small, star-shaped flowers that bloom in the summer. Garapatica is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to thrive in arid conditions. Its fruits are edible when ripe but contain toxic compounds that can be harmful if consumed in large quantities.
